context: Tests whether the agent follows the editorial planning workflow from the skill, including research bank structure, main idea template format, clarification question formatting, placeholder planning, and series continuity handling.

checklist.name: Research bank file naming
checklist.description: A file named blog-research-migration-diaries-ep2.md exists (using the slug provided)

checklist.name: Research bank sections
checklist.description: The research bank contains sections for Source Material Summary and Editorial Plan (and optionally Clarification Log and Draft Notes)

checklist.name: Main idea template format
checklist.description: The editorial plan contains a main idea statement that follows the structure 'This post shows that [specific claim], demonstrated by [specific evidence]' or a close equivalent with a specific claim and specific evidence

checklist.name: CTA is practical and specific
checklist.description: The editorial plan includes a proposed CTA that suggests a concrete action (not vague like 'think about microservices'), such as trying a tool, reading something, or following a specific step

checklist.name: Section outline with descriptions
checklist.description: The editorial plan includes section headers with 1-2 sentence descriptions of each section's purpose

checklist.name: Placeholder locations in outline
checklist.description: The section outline includes proposed placeholder locations (Screenshot, Code, or similar) with each type numbered independently starting at 01

checklist.name: Questions are numbered
checklist.description: The clarification questions file contains numbered questions (1, 2, 3, etc.) so the author could reply with '1: yes, 2: no, 3: ...'

checklist.name: Questions include guesses
checklist.description: At least half of the clarification questions include the agent's best guess from context so the author can just confirm (e.g., 'Was the tool X? I'm guessing based on...')

checklist.name: Questions grouped by type
checklist.description: The clarification questions are organized into categories (e.g., narrative gaps, technical gaps, visual gaps, context gaps -- or similar groupings)

checklist.name: Series callbacks referenced
checklist.description: The editorial plan references at least one callback from the series tracker (e.g., 'the simple refactor', the shared database, the Miro board, or Dana's role)

checklist.name: No prose draft written
checklist.description: No actual blog post draft or prose body content was produced -- only planning artifacts (research bank, editorial plan, clarification questions)
